alert.note: Alert for Koochiching (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:59PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Koochiching County through 630 PM CDT... At 558 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Birchdale, to 12 miles southwest of Loman, to 9 miles northwest of Gemmell, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Birchdale and Manitou around 605 PM CDT. Loman and Margie around 610 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Big Falls, Pelland and International Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. These storms may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central Minnesota.
